moves.1. e4: Fights to control d5 square and f5 square
moves.1... c5: Sicilian defence a counter attacking defence. Pawn fights to control d4 and b4 while opening a diagonal for the queen
moves.2... Nc6: Develops and puts more pressure on d4 square
moves.3. d4: Challenges black pawn and knight and it is recomended that black takes d4 pawn before white plays d5
moves.3... cxd4: Opens c-file and trades c-pawn for a center d-pawn. This c-file is important latter on for blacks strategy which usually involves the control of the c-file with rooks and queen
moves.4. Nxd4: White move knight again but move is still good because the knight is now in the center attacking lots of squares which could be useful latter
moves.4... Nf6: Develops,attacks and gets more control over d5 square
moves.5. Nc3: Best move(develops and attacks d5 square and defends e4 pawn) other move of not bad but not close to as good as Nc3
moves.5... d6: Pawn gets control over e5 square and opens diagonal for bishop. Other move such as g6 and e6 are also good
moves.6. Bc4: Places bishop on dangerous diagonal that attacks f7 pawn which is only defended by the king
moves.6... g6: Black plans to control the darck squares e5 d4 with his d-pawn,dark bishop and C6 knight
moves.7. Nxc6: Best move because it weakends black's control over dark squares and gives white attacking tactical chances
moves.7... bxc6: Only move and opens b-file which black should place one of his rooks latter in the game
moves.8. e5: Fischer trys to weakend blacks pawn structure and wants his opponent to move his knight twice in the opening
moves.8... dxe5: Worst move black should have played Ng4 or Nd7 or d5
moves.9. Bxf7+: Drags king away from queen and therefore black resigns
